com.thalmic.myo

Class Hub

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thalmic.myo.Hub

  • public final class Hub
extends java.lang.Object
    A Hub provides access to one or more Myo instances.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hub

        public Hub(java.lang.String applicationIdentifier)
        Construct a hub.

        applicationIdentifier must follow a reverse domain name format (ex. com.domainname.appname). Application identifiers can be formed from the set of alphanumeric ASCII characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9). The hyphen (-) and underscore (_) characters are permitted if they are not adjacent to a period (.) character (i.e. not at the start or end of each segment), but are not permitted in the top-level domain. Application identifiers must have three or more segments. For example, if a company's domain is example.com and the application is named hello-world, one could use "com.example.hello-world" as a valid application identifier. applicationIdentifier can be an empty string.
        Parameters:
        applicationIdentifier - The application identifier.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If applicationIdentifier is not in the proper reverse domain name format or is longer than 255 characters.
        MyoException - If the hub initialization failed for some reason, typically because Myo Connect is not running and thus a connection cannot be established.

    • Method Detail

      • isReleased

        public boolean isReleased()
        Returns whether the resources associated with this Hub have been released. If this method returns true, subsequent calls to any method, excluding this one and release(), will throw a MyoException.
        Returns:
        Whether the resources associated with this Hub have been released.
        See Also:
        release()

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases any resources associated with this Hub.

        After this method is called, isReleased() will start returning true. Subsequent calls to any method, excluding this one and isReleased(), will throw a MyoException.

        Calling this method on a Hub that has already been released will have no effect. This method also removes all device listeners.

      • setLockingPolicy

        public void setLockingPolicy(Hub.LockingPolicy policy)
        Set the locking policy for Myos connected to the Hub.
        Parameters:
        policy - The new locking policy.
        Throws:
        MyoException - If this Hub's resources have already been released.

      • run

        public void run(int durationMs)
        Run the event loop for the specified duration (in milliseconds).

        During that time, this method will block. For more information, see http://developerblog.myo.com/hub-run/.
        Parameters:
        durationMs - The duration to run the event loop for, in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        MyoException - If this Hub's resources have already been released.
        See Also:
        runOnce(int)

      • runOnce

        public void runOnce(int durationMs)
        Run the event loop until a single event occurs, or the specified duration (in milliseconds) has elapsed.

        During that time, this method will block. For more information, see http://developerblog.myo.com/hub-run/.
        Parameters:
        durationMs - The duration to run the even loop for, in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        MyoException - If this Hub's resources have already been released.
        See Also:
        run(int)

      • waitForMyo

        public Myo waitForMyo()
        Wait for a Myo to become paired.

        This method blocks indefinitely until a Myo is found. This method must not be called concurrently with run(int) or runOnce(int).
        Returns:
        A paired Myo.
        Throws:
        MyoException - If this Hub's resources have already been released.

      • waitForMyo

        public Myo waitForMyo(int timeoutMs)
        Wait for a Myo to become paired, or time out after timeoutMs milliseconds.

        If timeoutMs is zero, this method blocks indefinitely until a Myo is found. This method must not be called concurrently with run(int) or runOnce(int).
        Parameters:
        timeoutMs - The amount of milliseconds to wait for before timing out.
        Returns:
        A paired Myo, or null if wait timed out.
        Throws:
        MyoException - If this Hub's resources have already been released.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(DeviceListener listener)
        Register a listener to be called when device events occur.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to register.
        Throws:
        MyoException - If this Hub's resources have already been released.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(DeviceListener listener)
        Remove a previously registered listener. If the listener was never registered, this method will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.
        Throws:
        MyoException - If this Hub's resources have already been released.
